attributes.action: Prevent the UK government from introducing new licensing laws for air guns.
attributes.background:
Airguns already require licences when they are above a certain power yet new laws have been proposed to apply license requirements for ALL air guns. 

Airguns are important for pest and vermin control and are a fun hobby for many people across the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
There were 4,203 recorded crimes in which air weapons were used during 2010/11, a fall of 15% compared with the previous year and 70% below the peak recorded in 2002/03.

In England and Wales firearms were reportedly used in 11,227 offences, 0.3% of all recorded crimes.

In England and Wales there were 388 firearm offences in which there was a fatal or serious injury, 13% lower than in 2009/10. In almost 80% of firearms offences no injury occurred.

www.parliament.uk/briefing-papers/sn01940.pdf

attributes.action: Ban the use of Audible bird scarers
attributes.background: Ban the total use of bird scarers "gas cannon". These cannons are affecting the use and enjoyment of our homes and there is absolutely no legislation for something that affectively is a FIREARM. Our government needs to outright ban on them or closely legislate it

attributes.action: Reverse the Chancellor's decision on the Housing Benefit Cap
attributes.background: Elderly people living in Extra Care Housing Schemes will not get enough housing benefit to cover their rent and service charges.  If they take up new tenancies, especially if they move to a new development the Government proposes to cap their housing benefit.
attributes.additional_details:
National Housing Federation
BBC
Local newspaper coverage
Local authorities
Other housing providers

attributes.action: All healthcare staff to be trained on treating those with mental health issues.
attributes.background: My husband suffers with PTSD and some mental health issues. Since his diagnosis we have struggled to get him the help he needs. This has been exasperated by GPs, their staff and other healthcare providers being unprofessional, unsympathetic or even understanding of their patient.
attributes.additional_details:
In my capacity with support groups and organisations, I have heard various similar experiences. Patients being told that because they aren't suicidal that minute, they can't be seen because staff are too "busy", patients being refused medication, being told they don't have the "correct" symptoms, being told they are "making it up". 
If the people you are supposed to turn to when we need help the most don't treat us with dignity and respect, what hope is there?

attributes.action: RAF Mildenhall as an alternative Dragracing track
attributes.background: The United States Air Force pulls out of RAF Mildenhall in 2022. Mildenhall airport is fully operational and could easily be reused as a motorsport venue.

attributes.action: Appoint a youth representative to negotiations on exiting the European Union.
attributes.background: Acknowledging the evidence that 75% of young people (18-25) voted to remain in the EU referendum, we call on the government to include a youth representative in the negotiations on Britain's exit from the EU to speak for young people and their future in Europe.
attributes.additional_details:
The polls up to and following the referendum showed young people overwhelmingly in favour of Europe, one of the largest of these shows that 18-25 year olds clearly voted to remain: http://lordashcroftpolls.com/2016/06/how-the-united-kingdom-voted-and-why/

Recognising that this affects the future of our country and our long term economic stability, we ask that young people get a voice in shaping this future.

attributes.action: Stop providing security for Tony Blair's Overseas commitments
attributes.background: Taxpayers are still footing Tony Blairs huge police protection bill. In some cases 12 Metropolitan Officers are involved at a cost to the tax payer of upto Â£16,000.00 per week.  This equates to an enormous amount of money over the past 6 years.
attributes.additional_details: His firm, Tony Blair Associates has made vast amounts of money over the past 6 years, and both his private and commercial work has taken him all over the world with round the clock protection, to which he should at least make a substantial contribution.

attributes.action: Make cat owners responsible for their cats fouling on private property
attributes.background: Cat fouling on private property is not treated with the same seriousness as dogs. There has been a huge cultural shift with personal ownership of dog fouling and feel this should now be extended to cats
attributes.additional_details:
Cat fouling on private property is frowned upon, but perfectly legal in the UK, whereas dogs, for example, if caught fouling in public places, would have their owner fined, if caught. Cats are allowed to foul wherever they please, while dog's excrement must be picked up and put in special bins, or cleaned if the dog did not even belong to you. Cat poo has toxins in it, and in some cases is as dangerous as dog poo. There are obvious health risks associated with this, especially to young children.
This petition stands for fines to be placed on a cat's owner if there is evidence (photographic or video) that the cat had fouled on the property. Should there be a call for cats to be kept on leads?

attributes.action: Bring England in line with the rest of the UK & make Prescriptions Free for all.
attributes.background: These costs apply only to England as prescription charges have been abolished in the rest of the UK. In Wales, prescriptions have been free for everyone since 2007, Northern Ireland scrapped the charges in 2010 and Scotland followed suit in 2011, Workers in England feel they are being Penalised.

attributes.action: Start issuing on the spot fines for foreign drivers breaking UK driving laws
attributes.background: Foreign truck drivers speeding, overtaking in the third lane of the motorway and parking on hard shoulders and clearways
attributes.additional_details: A system should be employed whereby offending drivers are stopped at the point of exiting the UK, using the numerous cameras that already exist in the UK, and fined for offences committed on our roads

attributes.action: The UK must not leave the European Economic Area (EEA) without a referendum
attributes.background: The UK voted in a referendum on 23rd June 2016 to leave the European Union. No referendum has been held on whether the UK should leave the European Economic Area (EEA). Therefore we, the undersigned, ask HM Government to legislate that the United Kingdom cannot leave the EEA without a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The European Economic Area (EEA) comprises all 28 EU member states plus Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein. Membership of the EU and EEA is separate, as evidenced by Croatia's joining of the EU on 1st July 2013 and its delayed provisional joining of the EEA on 12th April 2014. Most rights enjoyed by citizens of EU countries apply equally to citizens of EEA countries, most notably the free movement of people. If the UK leaves the EU without leaving the EEA, it will be similar to Norway or Iceland.

attributes.action: Allow European residents living in UK to vote if there's another EU referendum
attributes.background: I am a Spanish resident living in London since 2000, working in the NHS and paying my taxes in this country. I believe is very unfair that the EU citizens did not have the opportunity to vote if we want to be out or in from the EU. My request is to give us a voice as we are tax payers supporting UK

attributes.action: STOP fining parents & providing evidence of ill children who miss days of school
attributes.background: My child has missed many days of school due to Asthma. He has regular flare ups and suffers with coughing fits/ weasiness & breathlessness as a result also causing lack of sleep and the need to stay at home. We are facing a court proceedings because of his low school attendance percentage.
attributes.additional_details: We have had to provide /medical evidence' and letters of consent from a doctor to say he is unfit for school. This is discriminating against a parents' verbal word, making us feel like liars when our child is poorly. This takes up valuable doctors appointments, when our children are not always needed to be seen by a doctor. Other bugs fly around schools where we should also keep our children at home but not see a doctor. STOP PROSECUTING PARENTS for educational statistical targets!

attributes.action: The Government ignores the EU and starts to negotiate and sign trade deals now
attributes.background: Article 50 is intended to cause restrictions and harms the UK economy.  We need to sign new deals before the EU imposes a deal on us that requires the UK economy to start from scratch at the end of the 2 year period.  We need to start now to get deals as an incentive for the EU to give a good deal.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has always been fastidious in following the rules though they are often ignored by Germany and France.  We are leaving the EU and there is no longer a moral need to keep to these rules.  By not setting up new deals NOW we risk leaving the EU with only the deal that the EU wishes to give us.  We need to replace the trade with the EU with other trade pacts that will give the EU the incentive to give us a fair trade deal beneficial to both sides.

attributes.action: Create an awareness campaign to highlight  the symptoms of type 1 diabetes
attributes.background:
Type 1 diabetes is on the increase in the UK, the biggest increase is in children, especially those under the age of 5 years old.
Unfortunately many people are unaware of the symptoms which can lead to deadly results. A delay in diagnosis can be fatal, children are dying needlessly.
attributes.additional_details:
Type 1 diabetes is a condition which is completely mis-understood, it has nothing to do with lifestyle, which is a common misconception. It complicates even the most simplest of tasks. 
There has never been a campaign that educates parents and medical professionals in the symptoms of Type 1 diabetes. Once diagnosed, and with the correct treatment and support nothing is impossible. You only have to look at our Prime Minister. 
Education is the key.

attributes.action: End the Breed Specific Legislation
attributes.background: BSL permits unfair treatment of certain dog breeds based on stereotypes. This is a petition to end the BSL. A new law should be brought in to replace the Dangerous Dogs act to ensure responsibility for a dogâs behaviour is placed on the owner or person in charge of it.
attributes.additional_details: It is the owners responbility to control there own dog or a dog they are in charge of. Also to seek help if their dog or a dog they are in charge of shows signs of aggression or behavioural problems.

attributes.action: Make welfare services VAT exempt
attributes.background: Why should families using organisations to help them with Dementia care, loneliness, respite etc pay VAT? Help us deal with the red tape that makes VAT applicable to a much needed elderly care service by signing this petition.
attributes.additional_details: If an organisation is not a Charity, or it is 'out of scope' for CQC regulation, VAT is required to be paid by end users. Support in the home does have to involve personal care. Currently, families choosing services from a LTD or LLP company to help themselves or a loved one rather than state or charity provision are penalised with 20% VAT on vital care services.  Volunteer services and Charities can't cope with demand, so if you are willing to  pay for services that are not "personal care", we do not think VAT should have to be added. Seniors Helping SeniorsÂ® is an organisation that has evidence of great care outcomes for families and we are fighting the VAT charges. Refund will be passed back to every single family who has had to pay VAT to date.

attributes.action: To apply CCTV in to the family courts.
attributes.background: To end the corruption in family courts, proceedings should be recorded. These recordings could be passed onto the police to enable them to investigate if allegations of lying under oath are made.
attributes.additional_details: By adding CCTV to prevent social workers, judges and parents from lying or turn them away from the idea of lying under oath.

attributes.action: Discuss a possible free trade area with the rest of the Commonwealth of Nations.
attributes.background:
We, the British people, will vote on the 23rd of June whether we leave the EU or remain.
In order to silence fear-mongering, we need a plan.
How about the Commonwealth of Nations, our friends that we turned our backs on 41 years ago in favour of signing up, unknowingly, for an EU straightjacket.
attributes.additional_details:
A free trade area between the 53 states of the Commonwealth of Nations would be within the interests of the British economy.
13 of these countries are among the fastest growing in the world.
âThe Commonwealth is the ideal platform for business and tradeâ¦ I hope that Indiaâs ties with the Commonwealth will move from strength to strength, and that the new paradigm will only mean greater warmth, greater co-operation.â Kamal Nath, Former Indian Development Minister
The Commonwealth is the future.

attributes.action: Cancel the court closures announced on 11th February, 2016 and improve justice.
attributes.background: There are currently 460 courts and tribunals in E & W.  The govt. announced the closure of 86 of these, claiming they are substantially under used. Why not ensure that they are used more often - speeding up justice. It claims that they will be within a 1 hour car journey, ignores public transport.
attributes.additional_details: The Govt. claims that the 86 courts are under used by 60%. This could be addressed by ensuring that matters are listed more quickly and the courts used more effectively. The Govt. claims that 97% of citizens will still be able to reach a court, by car, within an hour, ignoring those without cars. There are examples of round trips that will be costly and exceed four hours. This will stop justice being local and accessible.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate the matter of forcing schools to convert to academies
attributes.background: We were told Academy schools gave parents a choice from the mainstream, local authority system. Forcing all schools to become academies will deprive parents of ANY choice. This proposal was not in the Conservative manifesto in 2015, thus the government should not commit schools to this change.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no evidence that a universal academy system will work. Ofsted's Chief Inspector Sir Michael Wilshaw highlighted serious weaknesses at seven multi-academy trusts. He was also scathing about the level of pay given to the senior management in academies, with one head teacher earning Â£225,000 a year, more than the prime minister earns. Ref: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-35775458

If the Conservatives want to commit the education of our children to Academies then there should be a national debate and a referendum to make such an enormous change.

attributes.action: Debate restrictions on the sale of button batteries.
attributes.background: Button batteries are an under recognised and unregulated risk to children. They look like sweets and are sold without restriction or appropriate packaging on the high street.  When swallowed they often get stuck in the throat cause severe burns with life threatening complications.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.rospa.com/home-safety/advice/product/button-cell-batteries/

http://www.afpp.org.uk/filegrab/1psa-button-batteries.pdf?ref=1923

http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/campaigns/give-to-gosh/great-ormond-street-hospital-surgeon-warns-of-the-dangers-of-button-batteries-a6783641.html

attributes.action: Ban all religious practises from public outdoor areas.
attributes.background: Increasing trend of spreading religious practices, wordpship, prayers to parks, streets and in other public places directly discriminate non believing population and prevent peaceful coexistence of all religions with non believing population in the UK.

attributes.action: Rules on assisted living need to be based on need not age
attributes.background: My father is heavily disabled and has been turned down by an assisted living organisation because he isn't 60, there are far more abled people within this home, this needs to be based on the need of the person not the age of the person. Assessment of the care required vs age restriction is a must

attributes.action: Encourage companies to provide home based jobs for the disabled/chronically ill.
attributes.background: I want more large UK companies to provide home based job roles so the disabled/chronically ill have more opportunities available to them. Many disabled/chronically ill people hate not being able to work and want to contribute, but find it hard to find a well paid job to suit their ability.
attributes.additional_details: I am a sufferer of Ulcerative Colitis, a chronic illness and form of Inflammatory Bowel Disease. I recently had to step down from my managerial role due to my illness. I  looked for a legitimate UK home based job without success. I was only able to find US based work at home jobs. I want this for the UK.

attributes.action: create a law to make all cyclists wear correctly fitting cycle helmets
attributes.background:
This is along the same lines as the law for the use and fitting of seat belts in cars  
Look how many lives have been saved since the introduction of the above law

attributes.action: Ban plastic bags altogether and enforce environmentally responsible bags.
attributes.background: U.K. government has decided that plastic bags are to be reduced due to the environmental harm they cause. If they are so awful why not rid them entirely and instead have paper and other such bags so that members of the public are not juggling their shopping in an effort to protect the environment.

attributes.action: Include Fathers on Antenatal and Postnatal Mental Health NICE guidelines [CG192
attributes.background: Mark says âIâve spoken to fathers with bipolar, schizophrenia, clinical depression, anxiety and other mental health illness who have no support plan in place at this crucial time. Fathers Suffer from Anxiety, Postnatal Depression and Trauma at childbirth too. Research says 1 in 10 fathers are (PND)
attributes.additional_details:
Clair Rees 1001 Critical Days Blog http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/clair-rees/fatherhood-a-generational-shift_b_10564612.html
Fathers Institute Perinatal Mental Health : http://www.fatherhoodinstitute.org/2010/fatherhood-institute-research-summary-fathers-and-postnatal-depression/
 Fathers and Childbirth Trauma:http://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/health-and-families/health-news/why-the-trauma-of-childbirth-on-fathers-is-no-joke-8572222.html

attributes.action: Make Southern Rail give automatic refunds to all customers affected by delays.
attributes.background: For months now, those of us who travel on Southern have been blighted by delays due to 'staff sickness' which has since morphed into 'a shortage of train crew'. Annual ticket holders get no compensation and it is not simple for others to claim, so Southern continue to profit on poor performance.
attributes.additional_details:
Southern services continue to be severely affected by train crew availability including a high level of conductor sickness, which is leading to some services being cancelled for part or all of their journey.
Planned industrial action affecting Southern services on Tuesday 21 June
A list of the services which have been pre-cancelled is available here.

http://www.southernrailway.com/your-journey/plan-your-journey/live-running-information/incidents/#iAD816EDFC4114A84A299ABF7D41FE43F

attributes.action: Make audio-visual announcements be included in the government's new 'Buses Bill'
attributes.background: If the government are reviewing the overall regulation of the industry then it would be a suitable time to ensure that bus networks are fully accessible. Audio-visual technology speaks and displays next and final stop information, assisting those visually impaired to use the bus with confidence.
attributes.additional_details:
I am petitioning as I would like to see the government's new bill include a requirement for âTalking Busesâ. These are buses which include on board audio-visual (A/V) next stop and final destination announcements, as well as other important information regarding the service. This vital assistive technology enables people who are blind or visually impaired to get the bus independently and with confidence.

This technology is a rarity outside London, and that needs to change!

attributes.action: Make local councils responsible for the law on cannabis in their area.
attributes.background: The government has decided that a nationwide legalisation of cannabis is not on the cards, so perhaps a council by council ruling (bylaws) could be an alternative. A more democratic way that would allow the trialling of a regulated market in small areas first.
attributes.additional_details: A similar model has worked exceptionally well in the US, so why not learn from their successes and follow suit? Let the people decide what's right for them.

attributes.action: Amend guidelines: Smear tests for all sexually active females across UK.
attributes.background:
Women under 25 in Britain (excluding Scotland) are subjected to guidelines which limited their ability to receive smear tests at first request despite showing symptoms

A petition on this issue in 2015 reached over 300,000 signature, but those we elected to voice our opinions denied our request.
attributes.additional_details:
You can read the governments response to the petition of 2015 here: https://petition.parliament.uk/archived/petitions/62385

We may only account for 2% of 2011's cervical cancer diagnosis, but our health matter just as much as those 25+ females. 

We should not have to fight for our right to tests which can save women. We should aid in the prevention of invasive cervical cancer before our sisters & friends have to make the decision between a Hysterectomy or a Cone Biopsy.

attributes.action: All photoshopped/modified images of models to explicitly state their editing
attributes.background: We call for the Government to pass this simple yet awareness-raising law that ensures all edited images must state that they have been tampered with. We also hope to decrease the value that physical appearance has in our society, increasing the value of other qualities that truly make us human.
attributes.additional_details: The effect the media's portrayal of 'perfection' has on young people is that âself worthâ is based solely on an unattainable, generic, no-room-for-difference physical appearance. By passing this simple law stating that an image has been edited, by literally showing that models do not naturally look the way they are presented, we can raise awareness for the true beauty of âimperfectionsâ, individuality and that gorgeous spectrum that is body-size. Reintroduce reality and humanity into the media.

attributes.action: Make learning about FGM part of the curriculum
attributes.background: FGM happens from birth to adolescent it happens all over the world . Even thought It's illegal in the uk it's still practised. Raising awareness of FGM will help people understand the issues it makes girls everywhere face and enable people to comprehend that it's a violation of human rights.

attributes.action: Ban remote gambling nationwide, it is dangerous and destroying lives.
attributes.background: British families are being destroyed by remote (online) gambling. Individuals can easily lose property, retirement funds, business money, savings, and wages from the comfort of their homes and within hours resulting in suicide, depression, divorce and losing their children. It needs to be banned.
attributes.additional_details: Under section 24 of the Gambling Act 2005 - 'Children and other vulnerable people are protected from being harmed or exploited by gambling'. Age vertification and self-exclusion are not enough to protect the children of problem gamblers or the millions of UK citizens who would be deemed 'vulnerable'. Since most online gambling operators are based outside of the UK there is no financial gain for the British people that would remotely justify these companies being able to transact with or advertise to consumers in Britain.

attributes.action: Stop using schools as polling stations
attributes.background: Thousands of schools close during elections for use as polling stations.  This is extremely disruptive to children's education and costs parents in terms of lost earnings, annual leave or childcare.  Schools are seen as the easy option, when alternative facilities could be made available.
attributes.additional_details: Every year schools are closed to be used as polling stations during local elections, general elections and referendums, causing disruption to education and cost to parents. Given that the government has placed such high importance on school attendance (fining parents Â£60 for a day missed) it is hypocritical closing schools to save money during elections, particularly when the cost falls on parents. Schools cannot remain open with the general public on the premises so alternatives should be found

attributes.action: Provide GCSE Physics and combined science students with a formula sheet in exams
attributes.background: From 2016 onward the changes to the GCSE specification means that students will have to recall a large number of equations, that were previously provided on formula sheet. We think this in unfair and is a test of recall and not a test of their scientific knowledge or understanding  .
attributes.additional_details:
As teachers we think this unfairly disadvantages students of a lower attainment level, students who first language is not English and students who have special educational needs relating to memory. 
We call on the government to require Ofqual to instruct the exam boards to change this and to provide students with a full formula sheet.

attributes.action: To ask the UK government to call a General Election after the referendum
attributes.background:
After the referendum the nation will have made a decision in relation to the direction with which to take the country. 

This is more important in the event of a vote leave result

Its only fair and democratic that the citizens of the UK are allowed to chose a government to lead through change

attributes.action: Extend the "Help to Buy: Mortgage Guarantee" scheme until at least December 2017
attributes.background: The governments "Help to Buy: Mortgage Guarantee" scheme is due to end in December 2016. This allows buyers (not just 1st time) to put down a 5% deposit with the next 20% of the mortgage guaranteed by the government; this give lenders additional security against people defaulting on their mortgage.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the start of the scheme around 73,726 houses have been purchased with support from the scheme; of which 79% have been first time buyers. (Stats from www.gov.uk)

Extending this scheme would allow thousands more people the opportunity to purchase their first house in times when getting a large lump sum of cash for a deposit over 5% can be extremely difficult.

Additional information about how the scheme works can be seen here:
www.helptobuy.gov.uk/mortgage-guarantee/how-does-it-work/

attributes.action: Increase the rate of pay for NHS Nurses.
attributes.background: Working in immensely stressful conditions and unsocial hours, nurses pay needs to reflect this. Working as a nurse carries great responsibility and provides a valuable service within health care which needs to be recognised.

attributes.action: Force UK Cell Network operators to provided Cell Networks fit for rural business
attributes.background:
When in rural areas it is often impossible to make mobile phone calls and when possible the reliability of the signal is very poor, this includes both Voice and Data signals.
Agricultural businesses use mobile signals for different reasons, these system are often unreliable due to poor networks
attributes.additional_details:
Use mobile devises for voice or data in French rural areas then repeat this in the UK, there is a major difference in performance, the UK offering a system which is often poor in quality, unpredictable & not fit for purpose.
The difference appears to be the fact that the French system roams between providers while the UK doesn't allow UK devises to roam.
Poor quality UK Networks costs rural business and needs to be improved urgently. Rural UK business need a system fit for purpose.

attributes.action: Reform the GCSE for child care level 3- so we do not need a C in GCSE
attributes.background: So other's who are capable of working with children but are not capable of gaining a GCSE'S at a C grade in English and Maths and still continue to qualify and be counted as a level 3.

attributes.action: Stop Our Dad Being Deported In 24hours!Theresa May please dont' break my family
attributes.background: My father is being deported within 24 hours,he will leave his 4 daugthers and wife,the youngest is 3 years old.It is tearing my family. He has done everything to make things right & support us.Please dont let them destroy our family. My dad is a good person,every family deserves to be together
attributes.additional_details: Immigration does not care about family rights any more they have abolished this and we did appeal under these grounds.They say that my sisters and go and visit in the holidays.I cannot bear to see my sisters and mother suffer any longer please I urge you to please sign this petition and stop my  dad from leaving.I plea to all of you to please not to destroy my family.We have all been here for 22 years and they could give my dad a chance to be with his family.They are taking our dad away from us

attributes.action: Commit to close the funding gap in UK science research left by leaving the EU
attributes.background: The UK is a key player in international scientific research, accounting for nearly 16 percent of the most cited articles. The EU funded up to 17 percent of HEI grants, this deficit must now be met. Intellectual property is a vital british export, investment is of crucial importance to our economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Extra detail about how the EU helped UK science and they key issues that must be addressed:

http://scientistsforeu.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/SfEU_factsheet_12-2-2016.pdf

attributes.action: Compulsory blood test for anyone taken to hospital for suspected drug spiking
attributes.background: My daughter recently had her drink spiked, she was taken to hospital by ambulance and escorted by police, she was in a bad way but never got a blood test as a&e was busy, the police could not bring criminal charges against the person responsible as there was no evidence without a  blood test
attributes.additional_details: My daughter and others before her have unknowingly through spiking taken drugs which have had a traumatic and sometimes fatal consequences. Efforts should be made to stop or deter perpitraitors from committing this act. Police stated that a blood test would have confirmed what she had in her system and there fore charge the person with grevious bodily harm. drug spiking is a serious issue and is increasingly being used as a tool to incapacitate victims for rape or other hideous crimes.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for automatic service charges to be added onto restaurant bills.
attributes.background: Paying a tip to a waiter or restaurant should be completely discretionary and not be automatically added onto a bill. Restaurant diners should pay a tip on their own accord and not have to physically ask for it to be removed.

attributes.action: Stop plans for Transition Government in Zimbabwe that includes ZANU PF ministers
attributes.background: ZANU PF and life President Robert Mugabe via a system of patronage over the last 36 years has systematically destroyed the economy of Zimbabwe & impoverished its people. At the same time elite Ministers and cronies have become wealthy beyond measure, by effectively looting Zimbabwe's resources.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government in it's secretive Foreign Office has unilaterally decided that a TRANSITIONAL GOVERNMENT will be put in place to avoid "REGIONAL CHAOS" [sic], WHICH WILL INCLUDE the "elite" referred to in the previously. 
ZANU PF Ex-Ministers/Civil Servants/Sponsors cannot in any form be linked to Government or control of Finances. 
They will simply use this money to rig the 2018 elections as they have clearly done in 2008 and 2013 by using DEADLY VIOLENCE and systematic VOTER FRAUD

attributes.action: To stop/prevent a second referendum on Scottish independence.
attributes.background: As a result of the outcome of the EU referendum it has created a cocktail of uncertainty. Political stability will decrease the economic consequences. If a second referendum on Scottish independence is on the table, it will create more uncertainty and result in complete economic turmoil.

attributes.action: Full HMRC investigation into the  Panama Papers
attributes.background:
It has recently come to light through an industrial scale leak, namely the Panama Papers, that some UK individuals and businesses may have profited through tax avoidance overseas via shell companies. 
 
It is only right a full investigation by HMRC is conducted.

attributes.action: To stop parents paying for children they have been refused access to maliciously
attributes.background: I am wanting parents who have been maliciously refused access to their children the right to choose if they pay the other parent maintenence instead of been forced to by the child support agency when they are not allowed access due to no fault of their own just jealous ex partners.
attributes.additional_details: There are enough parents who have come out of relationships and had their children dangled in front of them and used as a weapon by their ex partners. I feel that if a parent stops the other parents access they are then forfeiting the right to gain financial help of their children's parent. Unless the courts deem the parent hasn't got the right to see their children I feel this should be law as this effects too many families in this country.
